In the table below, the colours are presented according to DSTU 4512:2006 technical specifications:{{cite web |title=ДСТУ 4512:2006 — Вікіджерела |url=https://uk.wikisource.org/wiki/ДСТУ_4512:2006 |website=uk.wikisource.org |publisher=Wikimedia |access-date=9 March 2022 |language=uk}} -[[File:Flag of Ukraine (Ratio).svg|175px|right]] -{| class="wikitable" style="width:60%; background:#f9f9f9; border:1px solid #aaa; border-collapse:collapse; white-space:nowrap; text-align:left;" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="2" border="1" +The '''state flag of [[Ukraine]]''' ({{lang-uk|державний прапор України}}; [[Romanization of Ukrainian|translit.]]: ''derzhavnyy prapor Ukrayiny''; literally ‘state flag of Ukraine’) is a banner of two equally sized horizontal bands of blue and yellow colour, which symbolize the clear blue sky over yellow wheat field. ([[Constitution of Ukraine]], [[s:Constitution of Ukraine#Article 20|Article 20]]) + +As a [[national flag]], the blue and yellow bicolor was officially used since the 1848 [[Revolutions of 1848|Spring of Nations]] when it was hoisted over the [[Lviv Town Hall|Lviv Rathaus]]. It is was officially adopted as a state flag for the first time in 1918 by the short-lived [[Ukrainian People's Republic]]. During the [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] occupation, the flag was outlawed and before 1949 there was no official state flag until adoption of the red-blue [[Flag of Ukrainian SSR|flag of the Ukrainian SSR]]. People who were hoisting the blue-yellow flags in the Soviet Ukraine were prosecuted as criminals. The blue and yellow flag was provisionally adopted for official ceremonies in September of 1991 following Ukrainian independence, before finally officially being restored in 1992. + +Ukraine celebrates [[Flag Day in Ukraine|Flag Day]] each year on August 23 since 2004.[http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/world/2012-08/23/c_131803737.htm Ukraine celebrates National Flag Day], [[Xinhua News Agency]] (August 23, 2012)
[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/kyiv/ceremony-of-hoisting-ukraines-national-flag-held-a-111423.html Ceremony of hoisting Ukraine's national flag held at presidential administration], [[Kyiv Post]] (August 23, 2011)
[http://tsn.ua/ukrayina/ukrayina-vidznachaye-den-derzhavnogo-prapora.html Україна відзначає День Державного прапора ''On Tuesday, August 23, all of Ukraine celebrates National Flag Day. Measures to raise the national flag are planned throughout the country.''], [[1+1]] (August 23, 2011) + +==History== +[[File:"Галицькі хоругви у Грюнвальдскій битві 15 липня 1410 року".jpg|thumb|left|320px|Battle of Gruenwald. Banners of the Lviv and Halych lands.]] +The roots of Ukrainian national symbols come from before Christian times when yellow and blue prevailed in traditional ceremonies, reflecting fire and water.[http://geraldika.ru/symbols/3334 Geraldika.ru Флаг Украины] The most solid proof of yellow and blue colors could be traced as far as the [[Battle of Grunwald]] at which participated militia formations from various lands of the Polish-Lithuanian Union. + +Yellow–blue, red-black, crimson-olive and especially raspberry color banners were widely used by [[Cossack]]s between the 16th and 18th centuries. These were not the only possible combinations, since normally Cossacks would fly their [[hetman]]'s banners, which were similar to the coats of arms of the nobility. Also, yellow and blue were the colours common on coats of arms in [[Galicia (Central Europe)|Galicia]]. In fact, the coat of arms of [[Lviv]] to this day remains a golden lion on a blue field. + +Some put the starting point of the current national flag of Ukraine in year 1848, when during the [[The Revolutions of 1848 in the Habsburg areas|Spring of the Nations]] a yellow and blue banner was adopted by the [[Main Ruthenian Council]][http://www.istpravda.com.ua/articles/2014/01/14/140850/ Blue-yellow or yellow-blue? Myths about the flipped flag (Синьо-жовтий чи жовто-блакитний? Міфи про "перевернутий" прапор)]. [[Ukrayinska Pravda]]. January 14, 2014 in [[Lviv]] and flew over the city's magistrate for the first time. Although this move did not have significant consequences, the newly formed Ukrainian divisions in the Austrian army used yellow and blue banners in their insignia. + +===Short independence: 1917–1920=== + +Both blue–yellow and yellow–blue flags were widely used during the [[Ukraine after the Russian Revolution|Ukrainian struggle for independence]] in 1917. For the first time in the [[Russian Empire]] the blue-yellow flag was flown on March 25, 1917 in [[Petrograd]] during a 20-thousand people mass [[Demonstration (protest)|demonstration]]. On the territory of the Russian Ukraine ([[Little Russia]]) the national flag of Ukraine was flown for the first time in [[Kiev]] on March 29, 1917 by soldiers. On April 1, 1917 Kiev saw a 100-thousand people demonstration that carried over 320 national flags. After that similar demonstration with Ukrainian flags took place across the whole [[Russian Empire]] even beyond the Ukrainian ethnic lands. Number of famous Ukrainian politician wrote their recollection about the April 1 demonstration such as [[Mykhailo Hrushevsky]] and [[Serhiy Yefremov]] stating that there were blue-and-yellow flags, while [[Dmytro Doroshenko]] claimed that there were yellow-and-blue. + +The blue-yellow flag was flown at the First Ukrainian Military Congress on May 18, 1917. + +There are reliable sources that indicate that an official flag was declared by the [[Ukrainian People's Republic]] in 1918 is blue–yellow. Some sources mention that the yellow–blue was adopted by [[Tsentralna Rada]] on March 22, 1918.[http://www.kmu.gov.ua/control/uk/publish/article?art_id=32027&cat_id=31295 State Symbols of Ukraine], [[Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine]], website. Other sources point out that no hard proof of such decision exists.http://vexillography.narod.ru/ukraine/unr.htm Instead, they refer to the decision on the Fleet Flag, which was set to be light blue–yellow[http://www.history.org.ua/journal/1999/4/10.pdf Ukrainian Historical Journal, 1999, #4, ISSN 0130-S247] as an indication that the official flag was light blue–yellow.[http://vijsko.milua.org/Khoruhvy_HA.htm Українське військо у ХХ-ХХІ сторіччі] Also were adopted other service flags of the [[Ukrainian People's Republic]].Grechylo A. Ukrayinska Terytorialna Heraldyka. Lviv, 2010, pp. 98-118. ISBN 978-966-02-5259-2 + +The official flag of [[Pavlo Skoropadsky]]'s [[Ukrainian State|Hetmanate]] also was light blue–yellow and became the same under [[Symon Petlura]]'s [[Directorate of Ukraine|Directorate]]. The flag of [[West Ukrainian National Republic]] was blue and yellow. The [[Free Territory|anarchist free-soviets]] that existed during the [[Ukrainian War of Independence|civil war]] used the black flag. + +New studies also show that [[Nestor Makhno]]'s formations in 1920 also fought under the blue-and-yellow flags. + +Among Ukrainian immigrant organizations there were proponents of both blue–yellow and yellow–blue flags. Eventually, it was agreed to use the blue–yellow flag until the issue was resolved in the independent Ukraine. + +===Soviet Ukraine: 1922–1993=== +{{Main|Flag of the Ukrainian SSR}} +[[File:Flag colors.jpg|thumb|right|Typical agricultural landscape of Ukraine, Kherson Oblast]] +The [[Ukrainian SSR|Soviet Ukraine]], similar to other [[Republics of the Soviet Union|Soviet republics]], used a red flag with the abbreviation "УСРР" or "УРСР" (Ukrainian Socialist Soviet Republic, or Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic from 1936) in gold in the top left corner. In 1937 the [[hammer and sickle]] symbol in gold was added to the flag. + +===Postwar Ukraine=== +In 1949 the flag of Ukraine was changed once again. The [[Soviet Union]] managed to obtain two additional seats in the [[United Nations]] by adding as members Ukraine along with Belarus. The change was due to the fact that all the Soviet flags were the same. The new Ukrainian flag consisted of a red (top, 2/3) and a [[azure]] (bottom, 1/3) stripes, with the golden star, [[sickle and mallet]] in the top left corner. The Communist party leaders such as [[Khrushchev]] and [[Kaganovich]] were afraid of using words ''light blue'' and ''blue'' which were used by the [[Ukrainian diaspora]]. + +During the Soviet period there were multiple unsanctioned attempts to hoist the national blue-and-yellow flag. In 1958 in village of Verbytsia, [[:uk:Ходорівський район|Khodoriv Raion]] there was established an underground group, members of which at night were raising national flags and spread anti-Soviet pamphlets.[http://www.istpravda.com.ua/columns/2011/07/29/48180/ Unknown flag-bearers. Yellow-blue against Red (Невідомі прапороносці. Жовто-блакитний проти червоного)]. [[Ukrayinska Pravda]]. July 29, 2011 + +===Return of the national flag=== +Under the influence of [[Mikhail Gorbachev]]'s [[perestroika]] and [[glasnost]] years, the individual Soviet republics had strengthened their sense of national identity, which led to the [[History of the Soviet Union (1985-1991)|Collapse of the Soviet Union]] in 1991. This concerned the three [[Baltic states]] and [[West Ukrainian National Republic|Western Ukraine]], which were the last territories annexed into Soviet Union. These efforts were accompanied with attempts to restore the respective historical national symbols. In 1988, the [[List of Lithuanian rulers#Lithuanian SSR (1940–1941 and 1944–1990)|Supreme Soviet of the Lithuanian SSR]] [[Coat of arms of Lithuania#History|re-established]] Lithuania's historic coat of arms as the state symbol. The Parliaments of [[Latvia]] and [[Estonia]] soon followed. + +The events in the Baltic countries soon led to similar processes in Ukraine. Particularly, West Ukraine and [[Ukrainian SSR]]'s capital [[Kiev]] (''Kyiv'') constantly held political demonstrations with the national yellow-and-blue flags waving above the heads of demonstrators. + +* On March 20, 1990, the town council of [[Ternopil]] voted upon the usage and re-establishment of the yellow-and-blue flag and the [[Coat of arms of Ukraine|''tryzub'']] as well as the national anthem ''[[Ukraine's glory has not perished|Shche ne vmerla Ukrainy]]''. On the same day, the yellow-and-blue national flag was flown for the first time in about 80 years on a governmental building in Kiev, replacing the then official [[Flag of Ukrainian SSR|red-and-blue flag]] of the Ukrainian SSR. +* On April 28, 1990, the oblast council (''oblasna rada'') of [[Lviv Oblast|Lviv]] also allowed the use of the national symbols of Ukraine within the Oblast. +* On April 29, 1990, the yellow-and-blue flag was flown from the Ternopil city theater's flagstaff without the [[Flag of the Soviet Union|official flag of the Soviet Union]] hanging above it. +* After July 24, 1990, the yellow-and-blue flag was flown for the first time over an official governmental building of the [[Kiev City Council]] on the ''[[Maidan Nezalezhnosti]]'' square of the ''[[Khreschatyk]]'' street.[http://www.bbc.co.uk/ukrainian/politics/2012/07/120724_flag_ukraine_history_kyiv_as.shtml Twenty two years ago in Kiev officially was raised the blue-yellow flag (22 роки тому в Києві офіційно підняли синьо-жовтий прапор)]. BBC Ukraine. July 24, 2012. +* After the declaration of independence of Ukraine on August 24, 1991, the national yellow-and-blue flag flew for the first time over the [[Verkhovna Rada|Ukrainian Parliament (''Verkhovna Rada'')]] building on September 4, 1991. + +===Attempts to revive Soviet flags=== +[[File:Soviet Znamya Pobedy.svg|right|thumb|150px|"Banner of Victory #5" was raised just below a statue on the roof of the Reichstag building]] +On April 21, 2011 the [[Verkhovna Rada]] adopted a law which allows to raise the [[Victory Banner]] on the Victory Day.[http://www.istpravda.com.ua/short/2011/04/21/36767/ Rada enforced raising red flags on the May 9 (РАДА ЗОБОВ'ЯЗАЛА ВИВІШУВАТИ ЧЕРВОНІ ПРАПОРИ НА 9 ТРАВНЯ)]. [[Ukrayinska Pravda]]. April 21, 2011 The current Victory Banner was adopted in [[Russia]] back in 2007. On May 20, 2011 the law was signed by the [[President of Ukraine]] [[Viktor Yanukovych]].[http://www.istpravda.com.ua/short/2011/05/21/39383/ Yanukovych signed the law about the Red Banner (ЯНУКОВИЧ ПІДПИСАВ ЗАКОН ПРО ЧЕРВОНИЙ ПРАПОР)]. [[Ukrayinska Pravda]]. May 21, 2011 On June 17, 2011 the [[Constitutional Court of Ukraine]] recognized the law as non-constitutional and proposed the parliament to implement required amendments to the [[Constitution of Ukraine]].[http://www.rg.ru/2011/06/17/znamya-anons.html CC of Ukraine recognized the use of Red Victory Banner as non-constitutional (КС Украины признал неконституционным использование красного знамени Победы)]. Russian Gazette. June 17, 2011 + +==Flag controversies and criticism== +===Origin=== +Some of the theories{{which|date=January 2014}} said that Ukrainian flag was given by the [[Silesia]]n knight{{cn|date=January 2014}} from the city of [[Opole]]—[[Władysław Opolczyk]], Hungarian governor of [[Galicia–Volhynia]]. It has the same colours as the flag of [[Opole]]. + +=== yellow-blue vs blue-yellow === +Interestingly, Ukrainians commonly refer to the flag as '''yellow and light blue''' (жовто-блакитний, ''zhovto-blakytnyi'')A little less often is used also "yellow and blue", "blue and yellow" and "yellow and azure". — a different version of the flag used during UNR ([[Ukrainian National Republic]]) years (1917–1921) with yellow on the top and blue on the bottom. The yellow on the top represents golden domes ([[cupola]]s) of Christian churches and the blue the [[Dnieper]] river. + +It has to be noted that although most Ukrainians identify their flag in the verbal language as "yellow and light blue" ({{lang-uk|жовто-блакитний}}, ''zhovto-blakytnyy''), the current flag in reality is blue (the top string) and yellow (the bottom string). The issue is quite notable, because the historical rotation of the flag (from yellow–blue to blue–yellow) did not affect the spoken language.{{cn|date=January 2014}} Back in 1848 the flag was indeed yellow and blue,{{cn|date=January 2014}} and it was later rotated to blue and yellow to be more appealing to the common person.{{cn|date=January 2014}} The common explanation of "blue sky above yellow field of wheat" was invented around that time,{{cn|date=January 2014}} and, although this evocation of a Ukrainian landscape has nothing to do with the choice of colours or the history of the original yellow and blue, it certainly has formed the Ukrainians' conception of their flag.{{cn|date=January 2014}} + +The head of the [[Ukrainian Heraldry Society]], [[Andriy Grechylo]] points to the fact that the discussion about order of colors was taking place as far back as 1918.[http://gazeta.ua/articles/history/_hruschov-i-kaganovich-boyalisya-slova-zhovto-blakitnij/512859#photo-3 Khrushchev and Kaganovich were afraid of the word "zhovto-blakytnyi" (Хрущов і Каганович боялися слова "жовто-блакитний")]. Gazette in Ukrainian (gazeta.ua). August 23, 2013 Nonetheless, both governments of the [[Ukrainian People's Republic]] as well as the [[Ukrainian State]] defined that the upper half would be light-blue, while the lower - yellow. During 1918 it was taking in consideration that light blue would loose its shade under sun, therefore it was decided to make color darker. + +Already in the 1918 draft of Constitution of the [[Ukrainian National Republic]] the order of colors was defined as blue and yellow. The same order could be found in legislative acts of the [[West Ukrainian People's Republic]] for November of 1918 and the [[Carpathian Ukraine]] on March 15, 1939. The argument on the order of colors was taking place in the [[Ukrainian diaspora]] as well. In 1949 it was decided that until in Ukraine it would not be defined a single state flag, the diaspora will be using the blue-and-yellow banner. + +===Shade of colors=== +There is also criticism in regards to shades. There are specialists who argue that according to rules of heraldry current set of colors cannot coexist.[http://gazeta.ua/articles/history/_sino-zhovtij-prapor-ce-znuschannya-nad-ukrajinskoyu-tradicieyu/508746 Blue-yellow flag is a cruelty towards the Ukrainian traditions (Синьо-жовтий прапор - це знущання над українською традицією)]. Gazette in Ukrainian (gazeta.ua). July 25, 2013 The head of the Ukrainian Heraldry Society points to the fact that it is not [[heraldry]], but rather [[vexelology]] that studies flags. + +==Other Ukrainian flags== + +File:Alex K Halych-Volhynia-flag.svg|[[Kingdom of Rus]], Ruthenia +File:Прапор В.З..png|Great Banner of the Zaporizhian Host Lower ([[Zaporizhian Sich]]) +File:Flag of Galicia and Lodomeria (1849-1890).svg|[[Kingdom of Galicia and Lodomeria]] (1849-1890) +File:Flag of Bukowina.svg|Kingdom of Galicia and Lodomeria (1800-1849) and [[Duchy of Bukovina]] (1849-1918) +File:Flag of Ukrainian People's Republic 1917.svg|[[Ukrainian People's Republic]] (non-official, 1917){{Cite book |last=Abbott |first=Peter |coauthors=Eugene Pinak |others=Illustrated by Oleksiy Rudenko and Dmitro Adamenko |title=Ukrainian Armies 1914–55 |location=Botley, Oxford, England |year=2004 |publisher=Osprey Publishing |isbn=978-1-84176-668-3 |oclc=57637763 |pages=[http://books.google.com/books?id=S0Us4SD3_3QC&pg=PA9#v=onepage&dq=tryzub&f=false 9], [http://books.google.com/books?id=S0Us4SD3_3QC&pg=PA13&dq=tryzub#v=onepage&q=tryzub&f=false 13]}} +File:Naval Ensign of Ukraine 1918 January.svg|[[Ukrainian People's Republic]] (naval flag; 1917–1921) +File:Volya abo smert`.jpg|Cold Ravine Republic (1919-1922) +File:Flag of Ukrainian People's Republic of the Soviets.svg|[[Ukrainian People's Republic of Soviets]] (1917–1918) +File:Flag of the Ukrainian SSR (1927-1937).svg|[[Ukrainian SSR]] (1929–1937) +File:Flag of Ukrainian SSR (1937-1949).svg|[[Ukrainian SSR]] (1937–1949) +File:Штандарт Президента Украины.svg|[[President of Ukraine|Presidential Standard]] + + +==Historical depiction of the flag== + +File:Ilja Jefimowitsch Repin 009.jpg|Yellow–blue and red-black Cossack flags at ''[[Reply of the Zaporozhian Cossacks]]'' painting by [[Ilya Repin]], 1880–1891. +File:Propaganda UPR.jpg|Yellow–blue flag on [[Ukrainian People's Republic]] poster, B. Shippikh, Kiev, 1917. +File:Kiev Maidan Flag.jpg|The Ukrainian flag flying on [[Maidan Nezalezhnosti]]. +File:UkraineFlag.png|Flag of Ukraine located on [[Union of Lublin Mound]]. + + +==Colors== +The Law of Ukraine states that the colors of Ukrainian flag are "blue and yellow", but other state bodies have determined the colors. In the table below the colors are given according to the technical specification DSTU 4512:2006: + +{| width="60%" border="1" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0" style="background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px solid #aaaaaa; border-collapse: collapse; white-space: nowrap; text-align: left" |- style="text-align: center; background: #eee" ! Scheme -!style="background:#0057B8;color:white"| Strong azure -! style="background:#FFD700;"| Yellow +!style="background:#005BBB;color:white"| Strong azure +!style="background:#FFD500"| Yellow |- -| [[Pantone]] -|Pantone Coated 2935 C -|Pantone Coated Yellow 012 C{{cite book |last=Svirko |first=W.|author2=A. Rubcov |author3=A. Gorpinchenko |author4=W. Sinel'nikova |author5=G. Docenko |author6=O. Kupko |author7=I. Potapenko |author8=E. Ershova |title=State Flag of Ukraine. DSTU 4512:2006 |publisher=State Standards of Ukraine |location=[[Kyiv]] |date=September 2006 | page=7}} +| [[Pantone|Pantone formula guide coated/uncoated, second Edition, 2004–2005 years]] +| 2935 C +| 012 C{{cite book |last= Svirko |first= W.|coauthors= A. Rubcov, A. Gorpinchenko, W. Sinel'nikova, G. Docenko, O. Kupko, I. Potapenko, E. Ershova |title= State Flag of Ukraine. DSTU 4512:2006 |publisher= State Standards of Ukraine |location=[[Kiev]] |year=September 2006 | page= 7 }} |- -| [[RAL colour standard|RAL]] -| 5019 Azure -| 1023 Gold (golden) -|- -| [[RGB color model]] -| 0, 87, 183{{Cite web|url=https://www.pantone.com/color-finder/2935-C|title=PANTONE® 2935 C - Find a Pantone Color | Quick Online Color Tool | Pantone|website=www.pantone.com}} -| 255, 215, 0{{Cite web|url=https://www.pantone.com/color-finder/Yellow-012-C|title=PANTONE® Yellow 012 C - Find a Pantone Color | Quick Online Color Tool | Pantone|website=www.pantone.com}} -|- -| [[CMYK]] -| 100, 63, 0, 2 -| 0, 2, 100, 0 -|- -| [[Hex triplet|HEX]] -| #0057b7 -| #ffd700 -|- -| [[Websafe colors|Websafe]] -| #0066cc -| #ffcc00 +| [[RGB color model]] +| 005BBB +| FFD500 |} -There has been disagreement over the shade of blue used in the flag. In 2013, scholar Dmytro Malakov argued that [[sky blue]] was the correct colour, and that, according to [[Rule of tincture|rules of heraldry]], [[Dark blue (color)|dark blue]] should not be used.{{cite news |url=http://gazeta.ua/articles/history/_sino-zhovtij-prapor-ce-znuschannya-nad-ukrajinskoyu-tradicieyu/508746 |trans-title=The dark blue and yellow flag is a mockery of Ukrainian tradition |title=Синьо-жовтий прапор – це знущання над українською традицією |work=[[Gazeta.ua]] |date=July 25, 2013 |first=Olga |last=Skorokhod |language=uk}} The head of the Ukrainian Heraldry Society said that this [[heraldry]] issue does not apply to flags. - -The flag is similar to that of the [[States of Austria|Austrian state]] of [[Lower Austria]], the [[Germany|German]] city of [[Chemnitz]] and the [[Hungary|Hungarian]] city of [[Pécs]], but all of those flags have a darker shade of blue. The flag is also somewhat similar to that of the [[States and federal territories of Malaysia|Malaysian state]] of [[Flag and coat of arms of Perlis|Perlis]], but has a reversed color arrangement, darker shades of blue and yellow, and a different [[aspect ratio]]. - -==Protocol and use== -{{more citations needed|section|date=August 2017}} - ===Legal status=== - -Article 20 of the [[Constitution of Ukraine]] states that "the State Flag of Ukraine is a banner of two equally sized horizontal bands of blue and yellow colour." ({{lang-uk|"Державний Прапор України — стяг із двох рівновеликих горизонтальних смуг синього і жовтого кольорів."}}).{{Cite book|url=https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine|title=Constitution of Ukraine}}{{cite web |url=http://zakon4.rada.gov.ua/laws/show/254%D0%BA/96-%D0%B2%D1%80 |script-title=uk:Конституція України |language=uk |website=Верховна Рада України}} - -===Vertical flags=== -[[File:Hanging flag of Ukraine.svg|thumb|upright=0.25|Hanging version of the Ukrainian flag]] - -In addition to the normal horizontal format, many public buildings, such as the [[Verkhovna Rada]], use vertical flags. Most town halls fly their town flag together with the national flag in this way; some town flags in Ukraine exist only in vertical form. The proportions of these vertical flags are not specified. When hung like a banner or draped, the blue band should be on the left. When flown from a vertical flagpole, the blue band must face the mast. - -===Stamps=== -[[File:Marka3.jpg|thumbnail|The "Freedom for Ukraine" [[Cinderella stamp]], featuring the Ukrainian flag with a gold fringe and a gold [[Coat of arms of Ukraine|coat of arms]] on top of the flag pole]] -The flag did not appear on [[Postage stamps and postal history of Ukraine|Ukrainian postal stamp]] issues until 1992, when they depicted the flag with the state coat of arms. Since then, the flag has frequently appeared on stamps. [[Cinderella stamp]]s of the [[Organization of Ukrainian Nationalists]] were printed outside Ukraine during the Soviet period for patriotic purposes. - -===Decoration=== -Traditionally, the flag may be decorated with a [[gold (color)|golden]] [[Fringe (trim)|fringe]] surrounding the perimeter of the flag, as long as it does not deface the flag proper. The tradition began with the [[flag of the Ukrainian SSR]]. In addition, the ''[[Great Soviet Encyclopedia]]'' shows a flag decorated with a gold star. Ceremonial displays of the flag, such as those in parades or on indoor posts, often use a fringe to enhance the allure of the flag. No specific law governs the use of the fringe. Traditionally, the [[Ukrainian Ground Forces|Army]], [[National Guard of Ukraine|Guard]], [[Ukrainian Navy|Navy]] and [[Ukrainian Air Force|Air Force]] use a fringed flag for [[military parade|parades]], [[colour guard]]s and indoor displays, while the [[President of Ukraine|Office of the President]] and local authorities use a fringed flag on all occasions. - -===Places of continuous display=== -[[File:28160-Lviv.jpg|thumbnail|The Ukrainian flag flying on the [[Lviv Theatre of Opera and Ballet]] with the statue of Glory]] -Ukrainian flags are customarily displayed continuously in certain locations. -* [[Maidan Nezalezhnosti]], main square of [[Kyiv]], traditional site for political rallies, including large-scale radical protest campaigns ([[Orange Revolution]] and [[Euromaidan]]) -* [[Presidential Administration Building (Kyiv)|Presidential Administration Building]], [[Verkhovna Rada building]] and [[Budynok Uryadu]] -* [[Kyiv City Council]] -* [[Lviv High Castle]] -* [[Vernadsky Research Base]] -* [[State Border Guard Service of Ukraine]] sites -* National, regional and local government buildings -* [[Diplomatic missions of Ukraine|Ukrainian embassies and consulates]] - -===Particular days for display=== -In particular, the flag should be displayed at full staff on the following days: -* 1 January: [[New Year's Day]] -* 7 January: [[Christmas#Date according to Julian calendar|Christmas (Julian)]] -* 22 January: Ukrainian Unity and Freedom Day -* 8 March: International Women's Day -* 1 & 2 May: [[International Workers' Day]] -* 9 May: Victory Day over Nazism -* 28 June: Constitution Day -* 23 August: Flag Day -* 24 August: Independence Day -* 13 October: Defenders of Ukraine Day -* 21 November: Day of Dignity and Freedom -* 6 December: Armed Forces Day -* 25 December: Christmas (Gregorian/Neo-Julian) - -===Display at half-staff=== -The flag is displayed at [[Half-mast|half-staff]] (or half-mast) as a sign of respect or [[mourning]]. When done nationwide, such a step is proclaimed by the president. Half-mast means flying a flag two-thirds of the way up a flagpole; the top of the flag must be at least a flag's height from the top of the flagpole. Black ribbons indicate mourning on banners that can't be lowered to half-mast. -* 4th Saturday of November: [[Holodomor Memorial Day]] -* Other historical cases: mass victims of accidents, [[Russo-Ukrainian War]] and [[Euromaidan]]; [[death and state funeral of Lech and Maria Kaczyński]], [[funeral of Pope John Paul II]] and [[11 September attacks]]. - -==Flag Day== -[[File:Ukrflagblue.jpg|thumbnail|right|The flag of Ukraine at [[Kyiv]] City Hall]] -{{main|Day of the National Flag (Ukraine)}} - -The Day of the National Flag in Ukraine is celebrated on 23 August; it began in 2004. Previously, 24 July was National Flag Day in Kyiv. The first ceremonial raising of the yellow-and-blue Ukrainian flag in modern times took place on 24 July 1990, at the flagstaff of the Kyiv City Council, two years before the flag was officially adopted as the National flag. Since 1992, the [[Independence Day of Ukraine]] has been celebrated on 24 August. Following a government decree, the flag must be flown from public buildings on this date and certain other holidays; not all are public holidays. Flags must also be flown on parliamentary election days and regional-specific flag days. The public display of flags to mark other events, such as the election of the president or the death of a prominent politician (whereupon flags are flown at half-mast), can be declared at the discretion of the [[Cabinet of ministers of Ukraine|Cabinet of Ministers]]. When flags are flown at half-mast, vertical flags are not lowered. A black mourning ribbon is instead attached, either atop the mast if hung from a pole, or to each end of the flag's supporting cross-beams if flown like a banner. -{{clear}} - -==History== -[[File:Flag colors.jpg|thumb|Typical agricultural landscape of Ukraine in the [[Kherson Oblast]]]] -The roots of Ukrainian national symbols come from pre-Christian times when yellow and blue prevailed in traditional ceremonies, reflecting fire and water.{{cite web|url=http://geraldika.ru/symbols/3334|script-title=ru:Флаг Украины|trans-title=Flag of Ukraine|language=ru|first=V.|last=Saprykov|website=geraldika.ru|date=May 30, 2003|access-date=October 2, 2017}} During the battle of Grunwald in 1410 two Polish banners of [[Lwów Land|Lwów]] and [[Przemyśl Land|Przemyśl Lands]] used flags with yellow and blue colours. - -Blue-yellow, red-black, crimson-olive and especially raspberry colour banners were widely used by [[Cossack]]s between the 16th and 18th centuries. These were not the only possible combinations, since normally Cossacks would fly their [[hetman]]'s banners, which were similar to the coats of arms of the nobility. Also, yellow and blue were the colours common on coats of arms in [[Galicia (Central Europe)|Galicia]]. In fact, the coat of arms of [[Lviv]] to this day remains a golden lion on a blue field. - -Some put the starting point of the adoption of the current national flag of Ukraine to 1848 when, during the [[The Revolutions of 1848 in the Habsburg areas|Spring of the Nations]] on 22 April 1848, a blue-and-yellow banner was adopted by the [[Supreme Ruthenian Council]]{{Cite web|title=Синьо-жовтий чи жовто-блакитний? Міфи про "перевернутий" прапор (Blue-yellow or yellow-blue? Myths about the flipped flag) |url=https://www.istpravda.com.ua/articles/2014/01/14/140850/ |date=14 January 2014 |access-date=2022-03-04|website=[[Ukrayinska Pravda]] Історична правда}} in Lemberg ([[Lviv]]), the capital of the [[Kingdom of Galicia and Lodomeria]], and flew over the city's magistrate for the first time. Although this move did not have significant consequences, the newly formed Ukrainian divisions in the Austrian army used blue-and-yellow banners in their insignia. - -During the [[Revolution of 1905|Russian Revolution of 1905]], this flag was used by Ukrainians of the [[Dnieper Ukraine]]. - -{{gallery items|width=180|class=center -|[[File:Alex K Halych-Volhynia-flag.svg|180x100px]]|{{FIAV|reconstructed}} Flag of the [[Kingdom of Ruthenia]] -|[[File:Alex K Grundwald flags 1410-05.svg|180x100px]]|{{FIAV|reconstructed}} Flags of the [[Lwów land]] banner during the [[Battle of Grunwald]], 1410 -|[[File:Flag of the Zaporizhian Sich.svg|180x100px|border]]|{{FIAV|normal}}{{FIAV|twosided}} Banner of the [[Zaporizhian Sich]] before 1775 -|[[File:Flag of the Cossack Hetmanat.svg|180x100px]]|{{FIAV|normal}} Flag of the coat of arms of the Cossack Hetmanate (1649–1764) -|[[File:Alex K Chornomorske Kozacke Viysko-03.svg|180x100px]]|{{FIAV|historical}} Flag of the [[Black Sea Cossack Host]] in 1803 -|[[File:Flag of the Ruthenian National Guard from Yavoriv.png|190x100px|border]]|{{FIAV|historical}} Flag of Ruthenian National Guard in 1848 -|[[File:Flag of Ukraine.svg|180x100px|border]]|{{FIAV|noflag}} Variant of the national flag since 1848 -}} - -===Early independence: 1917–1921=== -[[File:Богуш Шіппіх - Згинуть наші вороженьки, як роса на сонці (1917).png|thumbnail|UPR flag with the blue and yellow flag, [[Ukrainian War of Independence]], 1918]] -[[File:Украинская галицкая армия флаг.jpg|thumbnail|left|[[Ukrainian Galician Army]] troops with the blue and yellow flag, 1918]] -Both blue-yellow and yellow-blue flags were widely used during the [[Ukraine after the Russian Revolution|Ukrainian struggle for independence]] in 1917. For the first time in the history of the [[Russian Empire]], the blue-yellow flag was flown on 25 March 1917 in [[Petrograd]] during a 20,000-strong mass [[Demonstration (protest)|demonstration]]. On the territory of Ukraine the national flag was flown for the first time in [[Kyiv]] on 29 March 1917 by soldiers. On 1 April 1917, Kyiv saw a 100,000-strong demonstration where over 320 national flags were flown. Afterwards, similar demonstrations with Ukrainian flags took place across the entire [[Russian Empire]], even beyond ethnic Ukrainian lands. Numerous famous Ukrainian politicians wrote about the 1 April demonstration, including [[Mykhailo Hrushevsky]] and [[Serhiy Yefremov]], noting that there were blue-and-yellow flags, while [[Dmytro Doroshenko]] claimed that they were yellow and blue. The blue-yellow flag was flown at the First Ukrainian Military Congress on 18 May 1917. - -The official flag established by the [[Ukrainian People's Republic]] in 1918 was blue-yellow. Instead, they refer to the decision on the Fleet Flag, which was to be light blue–yellow,{{cite journal|last=Rozovyk|first=D. F.|url=http://www.history.org.ua/journal/1999/4/10.pdf|script-title=uk:Документи та матеряли: Про створення української національно-державної символіки у роки визвольної боротьби (1917-1920 рр.)|trans-title=Documents and materials: On the creation of Ukrainian national-state symbols during the battle for liberation (1917-1920)|language=uk|journal=Ukrainian Historical Journal|publisher=history.org.ua|location=Kyiv|volume=4|date=1999|issn=0130-5247|pages=115–121|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070705084455/http://www.history.org.ua/journal/1999/4/10.pdf|archive-date=July 5, 2007}} as an indication that the official flag was light blue–yellow.{{cite web|last=Chmyr|first=Mykola|url=http://vijsko.milua.org/Khoruhvy_HA.htm|script-title=uk:Українське військо у ХХ-ХХІ сторіччі: 'Командні хоругви' Галицької Армії (серпень 1919 р.)|trans-title=Ukrainian Army in the 20th-21st Century: 'Command banners' of the Galician Army (August 1919)|language=uk|website=vijsko.milua.org|date=2006|access-date=October 2, 2017}} Also adopted were several other service flags of the Ukrainian People's Republic.Grechylo A. Ukrayinska Terytorialna Heraldyka. Lviv, 2010, pp. 98–118. {{ISBN|978-966-02-5259-2}} - -The official flag of [[Pavlo Skoropadsky]]'s [[Ukrainian State|Hetmanate]] was also light blue-yellow and remained the same under the [[Directorate of Ukraine|Directorate]] of [[Symon Petlura]]. The flag of the [[West Ukrainian People's Republic]] was blue-yellow. The stateless [[Makhnovshchina]], which existed during the [[Ukrainian War of Independence]], used the [[Anarchist symbolism#Black flag|black flag]]. - -Among Ukrainian immigrant organisations, there were proponents of both blue-yellow and yellow-blue flags. Eventually, an agreement was reached to use the blue-yellow flag until the issue could be resolved by an independent Ukraine. - -{{gallery|mode=nolines|whitebg=y|height=100|align=center -|Flag of Ukrainian People's Republic (non-official, 1917).svg|{{FIAV|historical}} Version of the Flag of the [[Ukrainian People's Republic]] (1917) -|Flag of the Ukranian State.svg|{{FIAV|historical}} Flag of the [[Ukrainian State]] and [[Ukrainian People's Republic|UPR]] (1917–1921) -|File:Flag of Ukraine.svg|{{FIAV|historical}} Flag of the [[West Ukrainian People's Republic]] and [[Hutsul Republic]] (1918–1919) -|Flag of Green Ukraine.svg|{{FIAV|historical}} Proposed flag of [[Green Ukraine]] in Eastern Siberia{{cite web |last1=Smith |first1=Ned |title=Green Ukraine / Ukrainian Far East (1921, Russian Far East) |url=https://www.crwflags.com/fotw/flags/ru-zu.html |website=FOTW "Flags Of The World" |publisher=CRW Flags |access-date=24 October 2018 |date=24 February 2001 |quote=In “Flags of Non-Russian Peoples Under Soviet Rule” by Prof. Walter Trembicky [tbc69], pages 134 and 135, it mentions two proposed flags for Green Ukraine, or the Ukrainian Far East, neither of which was officially adopted, since the movement quickly proved abortive. There are simple black & white line drawings illustrating the two proposed flags on p. 133 of [tbc69]. The green in the two flags was described as dark or deep green. ... One [of the two proposed flags] was the Ukrainian blue-over-gold bicolor with a green triangle at the hoist.}}{{cite book |last1=Trembicky |first1=Walter |title=Flags of Non-Russian Peoples Under Soviet Rule |date=1969 |publisher=Flag Research Center |pages=134, 135}} -}} - -===Soviet Ukraine: 1922–1991=== -{{Main|Flag of the Ukrainian SSR}} -[[File:Ukrainian flag 1966.jpg|thumb|Photo of the Ukrainian flag confiscated by the KGB after it was flown in one of the Kyiv universities in 1966. The flag contains lines of the [[Ukrainian anthem]]: "Ukraine has not perished, it has not been killed".]] -During Soviet rule, the Ukrainian flag was banned,{{Cite news |title=The Revolution On Granite: Ukraine's 'First Maidan' |url=https://www.rferl.org/a/the-revolution-on-granite-ukraine-s-first-maidan-kyiv/30892599.html |access-date=2022-03-04 |website=[[Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty]] |language=en}} and anyone displaying it could be criminally prosecuted for "anti-Soviet propaganda". The first flag of the Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic was adopted on 10 March 1919, to serve as the symbol of state of [[Soviet Ukraine]]. Details of the official flag changed periodically before the break-up of the Soviet Union in 1991, but all were based on the red flag of the [[October Revolution]] in Russia and an exact replica of the flags of the neighbouring [[Russian SFSR]]. -The first flag was red with the gold Cyrillic sans-serif letters У.С.С.Р. (USSR, acronym for Ukrayinskaya Sotsialisticheskaya Sovetskaya Respublika in the [[Russian language]]). In the 1930s, a gold border was added to the flag. In 1937, a new flag was adopted, with a small gold hammer and sickle added above the gold Cyrillic serif У.Р.С.Р. (URSR, for Ukrayins’ka Radyans’ka Sotsialistychna Respublika in the Ukrainian language). - -{{gallery|mode=nolines|whitebg=y|height=100|align=center -|Flag of Ukrainian People's Republic of the Soviets.svg|{{FIAV|historical}} Flag of the [[Ukrainian People's Republic of Soviets]] (1917–1918) -|Red flag.svg|{{FIAV|historical}} Red flag -|Flag_of_the_Ukrainian_SSR_(1919-1929).svg|{{FIAV|historical}} 1919–1929 -|Flag_of_the_Ukrainian_SSR_(1929-1937).svg|{{FIAV|historical}} 1929–1937 -|Flag of Ukrainian SSR (1937-1949).svg|{{FIAV|historical}} 1937–1949 -|Flag of Ukrainian SSR.svg|{{FIAV|historical}} 1949–1991 -}} - -===Interbellum and Reichskommissariat Ukraine=== -The Organisation of Ukrainian Nationalists is a Ukrainian political organisation which as a movement was originally created in 1929 in Western Ukraine (interwar Poland at the time). For a long time, the OUN did not officially have its own flag; however, during the Hungarian and Polish aggression against the [[Republic of Carpathian Ukraine]] in 1939, Carpathian Sich, a militarised wing of the OUN, adopted as its flag a design taken from the OUN's emblem – a golden nationalistic trident on a blue background. The flag was finalised and only officially adopted by the organisation in 1964 at the 5th Assembly of Ukrainian Nationalists. - -The [[Ukrainian Insurgent Army]] was a Ukrainian nationalist paramilitary and later partisan army that engaged in a series of guerrilla conflicts during World War II against [[Nazi Germany]], the Soviet Union, [[Czechoslovakia]], and both underground and [[Polish People's Republic|communist Poland]]. The group was the military wing of the Organisation of Ukrainian Nationalists — Bandera faction (the OUN-B), originally formed in Volyn in the spring and summer of 1943. Its official date of creation is 14 October 1942. The battle flag of the UPA was a 2:3 ratio red-and-black banner. The flag continues to be a symbol of the Ukrainian nationalist movement. The colours of the flag symbolise 'Ukrainian red blood spilled on Ukrainian black earth'. - -{{gallery|mode=nolines|whitebg=y|height=100|align=center -|OUN-r Flag 1941.svg|[[Flag of the Ukrainian Insurgent Army|Flag]] of the [[Ukrainian Insurgent Army]] and [[Organisation of Ukrainian Nationalists|Organisation of Ukrainian Nationalists (of Bandera)]] -|OUN-M-03.svg|Flag of the [[Organisation of Ukrainian Nationalists|Organisation of Ukrainian Nationalists (of Melnyk)]] -|Flag of Ukraine.svg|{{FIAV|historical}} Flag of [[Carpatho-Ukraine]] and the 1941 [[Ukrainian National Government (1941)|Ukrainian National Government]] -}} - -In 1949, the flag of the Soviet Ukraine was changed once again. The [[Soviet Union]] managed to obtain two additional seats in the [[United Nations]] by adding Ukraine and [[Byelorussian Soviet Socialist Republic|Byelorussia]] as [[Member states of the United Nations|member states]]. The flag change came about because all the Soviet flags were the same. The new Ukrainian flag consisted of red (top, 2/3) and [[azure (color)|azure]] (bottom, 1/3) stripes, with the golden star, [[hammer and sickle]] in the top left corner. Communist party leaders such as [[Nikita Khrushchev]] and [[Lazar Kaganovich]] feared using words like 'light blue' and 'blue' in the official flag colors, as they were the terms used by the [[Ukrainian diaspora]]. - -During the Soviet period, multiple unsanctioned attempts to hoist the national blue-and-yellow flag were made. In 1958, an underground group was established in the village of Verbytsia, [[:uk:Ходорівський район|Khodoriv Raion]]; its members raised national flags and spread anti-Soviet pamphlets under cover of darkness.{{Cite web|title=Невідомі прапороносці. Жовто-блакитний проти червоного (Unknown flag-bearers. Yellow-blue against Red) |url=https://www.istpravda.com.ua/columns/2011/07/29/48180/|access-date=2022-03-04|website=[[Ukrayinska Pravda]] Історична правда |date= July 29, 2011 }} - -===Return of the national flag=== -[[File:Kiev 24.7.1990 Ukrainian Flag.JPG|right|upright|thumb|The Ukrainian national flag was raised outside Kyiv's [[Kyiv City Council|City Hall]] for the first time on 24 July 1990.]] -[[File:Waving the Ukrainian flag.jpg|thumbnail|right|A girl with the Ukrainian flag at a [[vyshyvanka]] parade]] -Under the influence of [[Mikhail Gorbachev]]'s policies of [[perestroika]] and [[glasnost]], individual Soviet republics gained a strengthened sense of national identity, leading to the [[collapse of the Soviet Union]] in 1991. This was particularly true for the three [[Baltic states]] and [[West Ukrainian National Republic|Western Ukraine]], which were the last territories annexed into Soviet Union. The national awakening was accompanied by attempts to restore historical national symbols. In 1988, the [[List of Lithuanian rulers#Lithuanian Soviet Socialist Republic (1940–1941 and 1944–1990)|Supreme Soviet of the Lithuanian SSR]] [[Coat of arms of Lithuania#History|re-established]] Lithuania's national flag and coat of arms as the state symbol. The parliaments of [[Latvia]] and [[Estonia]] soon followed suit. - -[[File:We Stand with Ukraine protest in Helsinki, Finland, 2022 February - 07.jpg|thumb|right|250px|An [[Protests against the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine|anti-war]] protest in [[Helsinki]] condemning the [[2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine]]]] - -The events in the Baltic countries soon led to similar patterns in Ukraine. In particular, West Ukraine and the [[Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic|Ukrainian SSR]]'s capital city of [[Kyiv]] were the scenes of near-constant political demonstrations, in which yellow-and-blue flags were waved by demonstrators. -* On 14 March 1990, the Ukrainian flag was raised for the first time since the establishment of the Soviet Union in the small city of [[Stryi]].{{Cite web|title=History of evolution of the State Flag of Ukraine |url=http://www.ukrinform.ua/ukr/news/istoriya_evolyutsiii_dergavnogo_prapora_ukraiini_infografika_2084779 |work=[[Ukrinform]] |date=August 23, 2015|access-date=2022-03-04|language=uk}} {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150817220933/http://www.ukrinform.ua/ukr/news/istoriya_evolyutsiii_dergavnogo_prapora_ukraiini_infografika_2084779 |date=August 17, 2015 }} -* On 20 March 1990, the [[Ternopil]] town council voted on the use and re-establishment of the yellow-and-blue flag and the [[Coat of arms of Ukraine|''tryzub'']] and ''[[Ukraine's glory has not perished|Shche ne vmerla Ukrainy]]'' national anthem. The same day, the yellow-and-blue national flag was flown for the first time in 80 years on a governmental building in Kyiv, replacing the then-official [[Flag of the Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic|red-azure flag]] of the Ukrainian SSR. -* On 28 April 1990, the [[Lviv Oblast|Lviv]] oblast council (''oblasna rada'') also allowed the use of the national symbols of Ukraine within the Oblast. -* On 29 April 1990, the yellow-and-blue flag was flown from the Ternopil city theatre's flagstaff without the [[flag of the Soviet Union]] hanging above it. -* After 24 July 1990, the yellow-and-blue flag was flown for the first time over an official governmental building, the [[Kyiv City Council]], on ''[[Maidan Nezalezhnosti]]'' Square of ''[[Khreshchatyk|Khreschatyk]]'' Street.{{Cite news |date=2012-07-24 |title=22 роки тому в Києві офіційно підняли синьо-жовтий прапор (Twenty two years ago in Kyiv officially was raised the blue-yellow flag) |url=https://www.bbc.com/ukrainian/politics/2012/07/120724_flag_ukraine_history_kyiv_as |access-date=2022-03-04 |website=BBC News Україна |language=uk}} -* After the [[Declaration of Independence of Ukraine|declaration of independence of Ukraine]] on 24 August 1991, the national yellow-and-blue flag flew for the first time over the [[Verkhovna Rada|Ukrainian Parliament (''Verkhovna Rada'')]] building on 4 September 1991. - -{{gallery|mode=nolines|whitebg=y|height=100|align=center -|Flag of the Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic.svg|Flag of post-Soviet Ukraine from 24 August 1991 to 28 January 1992 (red-blue){{Cite web|title=Про Державний прапор України|url=https://zakon.rada.gov.ua/go/2067-12|access-date=2022-03-04|website=Офіційний вебпортал парламенту України|language=uk}} -|Flag of Ukraine (Soviet shades).svg|Flag of post-Soviet Ukraine used from 8 September 1991 to 28 January 1992 (blue-yellow) -|Flag of Ukraine (1992-2006).svg|Flag of Ukraine used 1992–2006 -}} - -At the beginning of the [[2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine]], landmarks all over the world were lit up with the colours of the Ukrainian flag, while numerous cities raised the Ukrainian flag in solidarity.{{cite web | url=https://www.collingwoodtoday.ca/town-of-blue-mountains/town-raises-ukrainian-flag-in-support-and-solidarity-for-the-people-of-ukraine-5167910 | title=Town of Blue Mountains Info:Town Raises Ukrainian Flag in Support and Solidarity for the People of Ukraine }}{{cite web | url=https://www.euronews.com/2022/02/25/in-many-capital-cities-official-buildings-turned-blue-and-yellow-in-solidarity-with-ukrain | title=VIDEO : Ukraine invasion: Europe's landmarks turned blue and yellow in solidarity with Kyiv }} - -==Flag controversies and criticism== -{{main|National colours of Ukraine}} - -===Origin=== -One claimed version is that, since one of the first known coloured depictions of the Coat of Arms of Kyiv was mainly in yellow-blue colours, this tradition may have existed since the time of the Nordic-Slavic [[Grand Prince of Kyiv]] [[Volodymyr the Great]]. However, the blue-yellow colouring dates back to [[Kievan Rus’]], as an early version of the ''[[Tryzub]]'', Ukraine's national coat of arms, sported the same colouring as the seal of [[Sviatoslav I]] of Kyiv (c. AD 945). During the 1709 [[Battle of Poltava]], the Cossacks following [[Mazepa]] fought under yellow-blue banners, while their Swedish allies were under yellow ones. Some Cossacks and noblemen had coats of arms in yellow and blue.{{Cite web |last=Vannier |first=Alexis |date=24 Aug 2021 |title=" CHTCHE NE VMERLA UKRAÏNY " : HISTOIRE DU DRAPEAU DE L'UKRAINE |url=https://www.taurillon.org/chtche-ne-vmerla-ukrainy-histoire-du-drapeau-de-l-ukraine?lang=fr |access-date=16 March 2022 |website=taurillon.org |language=fr}} - -===Yellow-blue versus blue-yellow=== -Ukrainians commonly refer to the flag as "yellow and light blue" ({{lang-uk|жовто-блакитний}}, ''zhovto-blakytnyy'')A little less often they use also "yellow and blue", "blue and yellow" and "yellow and azure".—a different version of the flag used during UNR ([[Ukrainian National Republic]]) years (1917–1921) with yellow on the top and blue on the bottom. The yellow on the top allegedly represents golden domes ([[cupola]]s) of Christian churches and the blue the [[Dnieper]] river. - -The head of the [[Ukrainian Heraldry Society]], [[Andriy Grechylo]], points to the fact that the discussion about order of colours was taking place as far back as 1918.{{Cite news|last=Gazeta.ua|title=Хрущов і Каганович боялися слова "жовто-блакитний" (Khrushchev and Kaganovich were afraid of the word "zhovto-blakytnyi") |url=https://gazeta.ua/articles/history/_hruschov-i-kaganovich-boyalisya-slova-zhovtoblakitnij-/512859 |date=23 August 2013 |access-date=2022-03-04|website=Gazeta.ua|language=uk}} Nonetheless, both governments of the [[Ukrainian People's Republic]] as well as the [[Ukrainian State]] defined that the upper half would be light-blue, while the lower would be yellow. During 1918 it was taken into consideration that light blue would lose its shade under sun, therefore it was decided to make the colour darker. - -Already in the 1918 draft of the Constitution of the [[Ukrainian People's Republic]], the order of colours was defined as blue and yellow. The same order could be found in legislative acts of the [[West Ukrainian People's Republic]] for November 1918 and the [[Republic of Carpathian Ukraine]] on 15 March 1939. The argument on the order of colours was taking place in the [[Ukrainian diaspora]] as well. In 1949 it was decided that, until Ukraine defined a single state flag, the diaspora would use the blue-and-yellow banner. - -===Attempts to revive Soviet flags=== -On 21 April 2011, the [[Verkhovna Rada]] passed a law allowing the [[Victory Banner (Soviet Union)|Victory Banner]] to be raised on Victory Day.{{Cite news |title=РАДА ЗОБОВ'ЯЗАЛА ВИВІШУВАТИ ЧЕРВОНІ ПРАПОРИ НА 9 ТРАВНЯ (Rada enforced raising red flags on the May 9) |url=https://www.istpravda.com.ua/short/2011/04/21/36767/|access-date=2022-03-04|website= [[Ukrayinska Pravda]] Історична правда |date=April 21, 2011}} The current Victory Banner was adopted in [[Russia]] in 2007. On 20 May 2011, the law was signed by the [[President of Ukraine]] [[Viktor Yanukovych]].{{Cite news |title=ЯНУКОВИЧ ПІДПИСАВ ЗАКОН ПРО ЧЕРВОНИЙ ПРАПОР (Yanukovych signed the law about the Red Banner) |url=https://www.istpravda.com.ua/short/2011/05/21/39383/ |access-date=2022-03-04 |website=[[Ukrayinska Pravda]] Історична правда |date=}} On 17 June 2011, the [[Constitutional Court of Ukraine]] recognised the law as unconstitutional and proposed that the parliament implement required amendments to the [[Constitution of Ukraine]].{{Cite news|title=КС Украины признал неконституционным использование красного знамени Победы (CC of Ukraine recognised the use of Red Victory Banner as non-constitutional) |url=https://rg.ru/2011/06/17/znamya-anons.html|access-date=2022-03-04|website=Russian Gazette Российская газета |date=June 17, 2011 |language=ru}} On 9 April 2015, the Ukrainian parliament passed legislation on [[decommunization in Ukraine|decommunization]], banning the promotion of symbols of “[[Communist]] and [[National Socialist]] [[totalitarian regime]]s".{{cite news|url= http://www.newsweek.com/ukraine-purges-symbols-its-communist-past-321663 |title= Ukraine Purges Symbols of Its Communist Past |first= Nolan |last= Peterson |work= [[Newsweek]] |date= 10 April 2015 |access-date= 17 May 2015}}
{{cite news |url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/259775.html |title= Rada bans Communist, Nazi propaganda in Ukraine |work= [[Interfax-Ukraine]] |date= 9 April 2015 |access-date= 17 May 2015}}
{{cite news|url= https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/apr/20/ukraine-decommunisation-law-soviet |title= Ukraine to rewrite Soviet history with controversial 'decommunisation' laws |first= Lily |last= Hyde |work= [[The Guardian]] |date= 20 April 2015 |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20150516095241/http://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/apr/20/ukraine-decommunisation-law-soviet |archive-date= 16 May 2015 |access-date= 17 May 2015}} Since then, Soviet symbols, like the Victory Banner, have only been allowed in cemeteries.{{cite news|url= https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-32267075 |first= Vitaly |last= Shevchenko |title= Goodbye, Lenin: Ukraine moves to ban communist symbols |work= [[BBC News]] |date=14 April 2015 |access-date= 17 May 2015}}
[http://www.dw.de/ukraine-lawmakers-ban-communist-and-nazi-propaganda/a-18372853 Ukraine lawmakers ban 'Communist and Nazi propaganda'], [[Deutsche Welle]] (9 April 2015) - -==Flag of the head of state== -Throughout the history of [[Ukraine]], various [[List of heads of state of Ukraine|heads of state]] have used different flags. The designs differ according to the historical era during which they were used and the political situation in [[Ukraine]] at the time. [[Pavlo Skoropadskyi]] was the first [[List of leaders of Ukraine|Ukrainian head of state]] to use a flag. The current design, the flag of the [[President of Ukraine]], was adopted in 1999. In 2022, the President of Ukraine used a variant in which the left side of the blue upper-half contains the yellow ''[[Coat of arms of Ukraine|Tryzub]]''.{{Cite web|last=Basu|first=Zachary|date=2022-03-01|title=Zelensky tells European Parliament "nobody is going to break us" in emotional appeal|url=https://www.axios.com/zelensky-video-european-parliament-address-ukraine-ed88a2e1-ff9e-471c-9a4d-92e0406ff541.html|access-date=2022-03-04|website=Axios|language=en}} -
